channel.title: Finals
channel.description:
Even though the title may be misleading, I figured I would share this story.
Here lately, I have been doing lousy in school, not caring about my work. My mom received my progress report about 6 weeks ago and she was disappointed. Later on that day, she made me a deal. If I got all A's (Not A-'s) she would award me with $80.
Have your parents ever done anything such as this?

item.title: Finals
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

School is 10x harder than my job. While my job does only require typing skills, human communication, and program along with situation memorization, the only thing that school has helped me there is English.

Read full topic

item.title: Finals
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:40, topic:465706”]Quit your bitching. School is easy. When you begin working, you realize how cruise it all is. I don’t even know who this is directed at because i barely read anything you all say.
Either way, i believe my work is done here.[/quote]
I feel justified in bitching about how school is a measure of how much homework you do rather than how intelligent you are.

Read full topic

item.title: Finals
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Bowser: So true. Everyone at my school in honors pretty much expects an A, except there is one class who everyone says is SO HARD. The reason being is the teacher is extremely anal and she doesn’t have a single multiple choice test, besides the final. I believe the final has to be multiple choice since it is like standardized testing. She has all these rules too to knock off points. Like you have to write in standard manuscript, circle box or underline your answer, if there is a multiple choice question you have to circle the whole answer not the letter or else it is wrong, you have to write your full name not your nickname, and many more. I remember one test in particular I got the question wrong because I wrote lanthanide series instead of lanthanides series.

On the other hand you have basically every other class besides math (and even sometimes math) that uses multiple choice. English may have some short answer, but that is about it. You can almost guarantee yourself a C on a multiple choice test if you are good at looking for what is in common with the choices. I always look for one answer that sticks out because only one answer can be correct and the other ones are different.

Sorry for that little rant. I just am finishing up 5 hours of homework in one night because of that aforementioned teacher and because I’m a procrastinator.

Read full topic

item.title: Finals
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:34, topic:465706”][quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=571773.msg4152819#msg4152819 date=1352523151]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=571773.msg4148180#msg4148180 date=1352301311]

[quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=571773.msg4147899#msg4147899 date=1352286009]
Well my dad made a deal with me, i got straight A’s on my first report card sophomore year and he said if I continued to get straight A’s for the rest of the year and the two years after that I would get a new car of my choice. I did it (Graduated with a GPA of 4.2 and as 2nd Validictorian) and my dad bought me a new 2011 Nissan Maxima (33k), It actually worked out pretty nice, I go to a great school now with a nice car
[/quote]so he went out and bought you a crappy car <3
[/quote]Think of it as an added bonus, I really didn’t do it for that car but It was like that extra push that was always there when I got lazy or slacked off, plus I have to pay $700 a year for parking, gas is freaking expensive, general maintenance, and the bills just rack up. If anything its really not worth all that trouble and the car will probably be sitting at my parents for the next couple years lol. Either way, that bet kinda set my life into perspective and the more I think about, it really wasn’t about the car and if anything, it was my dad looking out for me <3[/quote]

pfft $700 for parking a year, I think you’d have a heart attack over here in England, I’m 20 and the cheapest insurance I found for a cheap car to insure was about $3200 a year [/quote]
That’s freaking expensive lol, I’m glad we have a ton of insurance companies which are waaaay cheaper, I pay roughly $1200 a year for insurance and its going down since I don’t drive around that much plus no tickets/accidents/citations so far.

[quote=“Acorn_, post:35, topic:465706”]I would recommend touching a dogs nose for a while, did that once for like 45 minutes straight once
I don’t think I’ve been this stoned in the afternoon for a while.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:25, topic:465706”][quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=571773.msg4147899#msg4147899 date=1352286009]
Well my dad made a deal with me, i got straight A’s on my first report card sophomore year and he said if I continued to get straight A’s for the rest of the year and the two years after that I would get a new car of my choice. I did it (Graduated with a GPA of 4.2 and as 2nd Validictorian) and my dad bought me a new 2011 Nissan Maxima (33k), It actually worked out pretty nice, I go to a great school now with a nice car
[/quote]so he went out and bought you a crappy car <3[/quote]
Think of it as an added bonus, I really didn’t do it for that car but It was like that extra push that was always there when I got lazy or slacked off, plus I have to pay $700 a year for parking, gas is freaking expensive, general maintenance, and the bills just rack up. If anything its really not worth all that trouble and the car will probably be sitting at my parents for the next couple years lol. Either way, that bet kinda set my life into perspective and the more I think about, it really wasn’t about the car and if anything, it was my dad looking out for me <3

item.title: Finals
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

tyb97:

Bowser: I love how he completely missed what you meant.

If i’m the person you’re referring to, you are correct. I didn’t completely understand what he was getting at.

The point is, I am being awarded for receiving straight A’s, not that it’s difficult, I just don’t feel as if I need to try. That’s completely ignorant on my part, considering I want to get into a decent college and do something useful with my life. However, I doubt that will happen due to the lack of effort put into school these past two years.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I see, never mind.

Read full topic

item.title: Finals
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

tyb97:

How you were questioning the legitimacy and the level of intelligence his school brought to him. Implying that’s what you mean, and that I’m not just making myself look stupid at this point.

My point is that there is something wrong with parents expecting straight A’s, when the requirements should be high enough that you have to make an real effort.

My point about multiple choice quizzes is that you only need to learn to recognize the answer. Getting A’s on them isn’t hard.

Read full topic
